com.att.research.xacml.api.pip

Interface PIPResponse

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    StdMutablePIPResponse, StdPIPResponse, StdSinglePIPResponse

    public interface PIPResponse
    PIPResponse is the interface that objects implement that represent a response from a PIPEngine.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.1 $
    Author:
    car

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Collection<Attribute> getAttributes()
      Gets the Collection of Attributes returned from a PIPEngine.
      Status getStatus()
      Gets the Status of the request to retrieve attributes from a PIPEngine.
      boolean isSimple()
      Determines if this PIPResponse is simple or not.

    • Method Detail

      • getStatus

        Status getStatus()
        Gets the Status of the request to retrieve attributes from a PIPEngine.
        Returns:
        the Status of the request to retrieve attributes from a PIPEngine

      • getAttributes

        java.util.Collection<Attribute> getAttributes()
        Gets the Collection of Attributes returned from a PIPEngine. The caller must not modify the returned Collection. The implementation is free to enforce this with unmodifiable collections.
        Returns:
        The Collection of Attributes returned or an empty list if none are found

      • isSimple

        boolean isSimple()
        Determines if this PIPResponse is simple or not. A simple PIPResponse contains a single Attribute whose AttributeValues are all of the same data type.
        Returns:
        true if this PIPResponse is simple, else false.
